items.title: Yet another recession indicator is flashing as consumer confidence declines sharply in September
items.description: Consumer confidence has dropped below key thresholds, challenging Fed policymakers and Wall Street’s bullish market view.

items.title: We’re not in an ‘AI winter’—but here’s how to survive a cold snap
items.description: Experts' strategies to steer AI investments wisely—and weather the chill.

items.title: Inside Intel, employees say the famous culture gradually fell apart—and worsened the chipmaker’s downward spiral
items.description: Intel was famous for its company culture. Understanding how it deteriorated offers lessons for other tech high-fliers.

items.title: The consulting giant that creates more Fortune 500 chiefs than anyone else
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

items.title: Single mother sues — and beats — Kentucky for kicking her off food stamps because she bought food at the store where she worked
items.description: Franklin County Judge Thomas Wingate said it was "draconian" without "clear and convincing evidence that intentional trafficking was occurring."
